data.title: Birthday party
data.text: Was there with a group to celebrate a birthday.  Usual bar food - chicken wings for appetizers, then burgers and sandwiches.  We had a private party room with bar for the event.  Food was okay nothing special.

data.title: Fun Trivia
data.text: Wednesday night trivia is a blast; bring friends and get there early. Just know that the wait staff is largely rude and the shorter lady inside is really mean.

data.title: Burger Joint!
data.text: A great simple double bacon cheese burger.  Ice cold beer and great drinks.   Soft pretzels with cheese new on the menu.   Wings are good,  they need more choices of sauces!  Servers are fun and a relaxed atmosphere.

data.title: Typical "Legion" feel and food
data.text: Pretty good bar food, nothing super special food-wise at this place. I do enjoy the 1919 root beer on tap though! Burgers are tasty, wings are breaded and not typical buffalo wings, but still very good if you like that style. They have a cool area where they can open up some garage doors when the weather is nice, and that area is a little "fancier" than the rest of the bar.

data.title: Local Spot - Bar and Grill
data.text: We visited for lunch on a Friday and it was not crowded at all.  The menu has average bar fare and the beer taps had an good selection.  We each ordered sandwiches - a cheeseburger with fries and a chicken wrap with tortilla chips.  The food, as compared to other local spots, was not outstanding.  We did have an issue with the server stacking the plastic food baskets on top of each other while carrying to the table.  It made us wonder if they were washed between uses, otherwise...yuck.  Service was a little slow, although in her defense, she appeared to be working alone.  Overall, there are much better places in Bloomington for grill fare - if you are looking for a bar for a place to watch a game, etc. this is a perfectly fine option.  It looks like, in warmer weather, there is a patio type area too.

data.title: Hit the Spot!
data.text: We tried to go to a place called Chevy's but couldn't stand the prospect of paying 16 bucks for enchilladas. Sports page was more our speed, not fancy but very tasty. Standard burgers with fresh lettuce, tomato and onion with standard fries and poppers the likes of which I'd never seen back in Milwaukee... bits of jalapeño in cheddar sauce in a tasty golden shell. Service was great and so was the dive bar atmosphere. The strangest part was the pull tab booth at which all the patrons stopped at at least once. Loved it.

data.title: It's what you might expect.
data.text:
Two of us ate at the Sports Page. We chose this because we were in the area, it has televisions, and the game was on.
She had the Mushroom and Swiss burger with fries. She said is was delicious! That was more than I could say for the Polish Sausage. It was grilled, had split open, and the result appeared to have been a complete lack of attention paid by the cook. It was totally black and carbonized on the exterior, while the interior seemed raw. A Polish sausage, in my experience, is a fully cooked item which requires only reheating. This may have been from a region of Poland with which I am unfamiliar. I had chips and a pickle with the sausage, which meant un-salted ripples potato chips and a couple slices of hamburger dill pickles.
The prices are reasonable, so I guess we did get what I paid for.

data.title: Perfect Neighborhood Bar & Grill
data.text: This is a place that has awesome pub grub, good beer selection, and a down home feel. Its not your white table cloth 5 stars, its the place you go and feel really comfortable like at home 5 star place. And it has really good cheese curds to boot. I love this place.
